page.title: 01Rural South Avon
page.content: This area of South Avon between Wrington and Winford is entirely rural - the only village within it being Redhill with about 20 houses.In the area there are a further 100 scattered houses and over 20 farms. The countryside is hilly and criss- crossed by small lanes,the only major road being the A38. The area is divided between the parishes of Wrington,Butcombe,Winford and Nempnett Thrubwell.Wrington and Butcombe are in Woodspring district and Weston parliamentary constituency, Winford is in Woodspring district and Woodspring constituency and Nempnett Thrubwell is in Wansdyke district and Woodspring constituency. Apart from work on farms and at Bristol airport,many people commute to Bristol or Weston-super-mare. The weather is mostly mild and wet.
